articles.title: Patient with deadly virus in Arizona released from isolation
articles.description: PHOENIX (AP) — An Arizona man was released from isolation 26 days after he tested positive for a deadly virus that originated in China, county health officials said.
articles.content:
PHOENIX (AP) An Arizona man was released from isolation 26 days after he tested positive for a deadly virus that originated in China, county health officials said.
The patient, who has ties to Arizona State University in Tempe, is no longer being infected by… [+1251 chars]

articles.author: By JOVANA GEC Associated Press
articles.title: Serbia offers support to China in 'battle' with new virus
articles.description: BELGRADE, Serbia (AP) — Waving Chinese flags, several dozen people gathered Saturday in Serbia's capital to show support for China as it struggles to contain a new virus that started in the Asian country but has spread globally.

articles.author: By COLLEEN BARRY AP Fashion Writer
articles.title: Milan Fashion Week carries on amid virus, economic concern
articles.description: MILAN (AP) — Runway shows continued apace on the fourth day of Milan Fashion Week as the itinerant fashion crowd took an analytical attitude toward the cases of the virus from China clustered not far away in northern Italy.

articles.title: Iran reports another death, 10 new cases of new coronavirus
articles.description: TEHRAN, Iran (AP) — Iranian health authorities on Saturday reported a fifth death from the new virus that emerged in China, and said the fatality was from among 10 new confirmed cases of the virus in Iran.
articles.content:
TEHRAN, Iran (AP) Iranian health authorities on Saturday reported a fifth death from the new virus that emerged in China, and said the fatality was from among 10 new confirmed cases of the virus in Iran.

articles.author: By The Associated Press
articles.title: New virus has infected more than 77,000 people globally
articles.description: A viral outbreak that began in China has infected more than 77,000 people globally. The World Health Organization has named the illness COVID-19, referring to its origin late last year and the coronavirus that causes it.
